Utterance: <synch>
Hi! It’s great to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
Hi, Ellie! I’ve been doing well, actually. I joined that hiking group, and it was amazing!
That’s fantastic! Tell me more about your experience.
I met some really nice people, and the hike was beautiful. It felt great to be outdoors.
That sounds like a wonderful experience! How did it feel to connect with new people?
It felt refreshing! Everyone was friendly, and we shared some laughs along the way.
Laughter is such a great way to bond. Did you feel any anxiety during the hike?
Surprisingly, no! I felt pretty relaxed, which is a nice change.
That’s wonderful progress! It seems like you’re taking positive steps towards managing your anxiety. Have you been able to maintain that feeling of relaxation since then?
Mostly, yes. I’ve been more mindful about taking breaks and enjoying my surroundings.
Mindfulness can be incredibly beneficial. Have you practiced any specific mindfulness techniques?
I’ve been trying to focus on my breath when I feel overwhelmed. It helps me center myself.
That’s a great strategy! Breathing techniques can really ground us in the moment. Have you encountered any challenges since our last session?
Well, I did have a moment of anxiety when I had to deal with a rude customer at work.
That sounds tough. How did you handle that situation?
I took a deep breath and tried to stay calm. I didn’t let it get to me as much as before.
That’s a significant improvement! It shows you’re applying what we’ve discussed. What did you do afterward to help yourself feel better?
I took a short walk during my break and listened to music. It helped me reset.
That’s a great way to cope! Music and movement can be very therapeutic. Have you continued to reach out to friends as we discussed?
Yes! I called a friend last week, and we went out for coffee. It was nice to catch up.
That’s wonderful! Social connections can really boost our mood. How did you feel during and after your coffee date?
I felt happy and energized. It reminded me how important those connections are.
It’s great that you’re recognizing the value of social interactions. Are there any other friends you’d like to reconnect with?
I’d like to reach out to another friend I haven’t seen in a while. I think I’ll do that this week.
That sounds like a good plan! Setting that intention can help strengthen your relationships. Is there anything specific you’d like to talk about today?
I want to explore my past relationships a bit more. I’ve been thinking about them a lot lately.
Okay, let’s dive into that. What specifically has been on your mind?
I keep comparing my past partners to what I want now, and it’s making me feel conflicted.
That’s understandable. It’s common to reflect on past experiences. What qualities from those relationships do you think you want to avoid in the future?
I want to avoid partners who are overly critical or dismissive. I need someone supportive.
That’s a valuable insight. Recognizing what you don’t want can help you identify what you do want. How do you feel about your ability to set boundaries in future relationships?
I think I’m getting better at it. I’ve learned to speak up for myself more.
That’s a significant step! Setting boundaries is essential for healthy relationships. How do you envision yourself doing that?
I think I’ll be more upfront about my needs and expectations from the start.
That sounds like a solid plan. Being open about your needs can foster better communication. Have you thought about what your ideal first date would look like?
I imagine something fun and casual, like going to an amusement park or a fun activity.
That sounds exciting! Engaging in activities can help ease any pressure. What do you think would help you feel more confident going into a date?
Maybe reminding myself to just be myself and enjoy the moment, rather than overthinking everything.
That’s a healthy mindset. Focusing on enjoying the experience can help reduce anxiety. Is there anything else you’d like to explore today?
I think I’m good for now. I appreciate your help, Ellie.
I’m glad to hear that! I look forward to hearing about your next steps in our next session. Take care!
You too! Bye!
